word: I have answered your letter, but did not send you what I wrote, because I knew that for some time you have been under temptation, and that anything I might say would be liable to be misconstrued, and would not have the influence upon your mind that would relieve your feelings. Nothing I can say will be of value to you as long as you have not an understanding of the work the Lord has given me to do.--Letter 32, 1899, p. 1. (To Mr. and Mrs. Muckersey, typed February 14, 1899.)
